meanings.definition: Exogenisms: beliefs or practices originating from outside a particular group or culture.
meanings.sent1: The exogenisms of the ancient tribe were different from their own traditions.
meanings.sent2: She studied the exogenisms of various religions to understand cultural diversity.
meanings.sent3: The exogenisms of wearing socks with sandals seemed strange to the locals.
meanings.sent4: The exogenisms of celebrating Halloween spread quickly among the community.
meanings.sent5: His exogenisms of cooking included spices from faraway lands.

meanings.definition: Exogenisms: the study or analysis of external influences on a system or entity.
meanings.sent1: The exogenisms of climate change on ecosystems are concerning scientists.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use exogenisms to understand how technology impacts society.
meanings.sent3: The exogenisms of a sudden rainstorm disrupted the picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: Her exogenisms on the stock market helped her make wise investments.
meanings.sent5: The exogenisms of social media on relationships are complex and varied.
